ast

Class AST

  • java.lang.Object
    • ast.AST
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActualArgsTree, AddOpTree, AssignTree, BlockTree, BoolTypeTree, CallTree, CharTree, charTypeTree, DeclTree, DoTree, EheadTree, FFTree, FloatTree, FloatType, FormalsTree, ForTree, FunctionDeclTree, IdTree, IfTree, IntTree, IntTypeTree, MultOpTree, NegTree, NotTree, powerTree, ProgramTree, RelOpTree, ReturnTree, SciNTree, StringTree, StringTypeTree, WhileTree

    public abstract class AST
extends java.lang.Object
    The AST Abstract class is the Abstract Syntax Tree representation; each node contains
    1. references to its kids,
    2. its unique node number used for printing/debugging,
    3. its decoration used for constraining and code generation, and
    4. a label for code generation
    The AST is built by the Parser

      • accept

        public abstract java.lang.Object accept(ASTVisitor v)
        accept the visitor for this node - this method must be defined in each of the subclasses of AST
        Parameters:
        v - is the ASTVisitor visiting this node (currently, a printer, constrainer and code generator)
        Returns:
        the desired Object, as determined by the visitor
